reviewText: This sappy little show has captured my 20 month olds attention from the first viewing.  The stories are sweet and short (5 minutes each).  She loves the song and all the characters.  She does NOT like the episode with the clown, so we skip that one...this is a great DVD for the 2 1/2 and under crowd.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I didn't even realize there were Little People DVDs! Since my grandaughter loves all her Little People toys,I decided to try this selection and the" Fun To Learn Collection. She loves both,but I really appreciate the lessons about friendship in this one,and that wonderful song that runs throughout, I can't get it out of my head,LOL! Just adorable and so colorful. These should be in every parent/granparent's library!
summary: Wonderful Stories,My 4Yr. Old Grandaughter and I Love This!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We love this Little People DVD, it is cute and refreshing.  Very adorable!  We don't mind hearing this over and over again in the background as our 26 month old daughter watches (she's been hooked on the LP shows since she was 6 months old!).  It has a pleasant sound and clean-cut teachings.  Not grating to the nerves like Dora the Explorer and Blues Clues.  The only thing I would like to change is the DVD Menu.  Right now, the episodes play 5 at a time - I wish it gave the option of playing all 10 back-to-back.  Otherwise, fantastic DVD with 10 great LP episodes!  Another good one is the Creativity Collection!  Just avoid the Storytime Collection as it is half repeats and almost nothing new.
Title: N/A

reviewText: All the DVD's in this series are great.  My daughter and I enjoyed viewing them when she was younger.  Good value for the money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Honestly, I cannot believe the positive reviews this product has received here!  I find I can usually rely on amazon reviews for good information, but this is a truly awful DVD.  It's full of superficial, meaningless stories and silly clay dolls with beady little black eyes and no human expression whatsoever.There are SO many more worthwhile shows for this age group out there: Little Einsteins, classic Sesame Street (Cookie Monster's Best Bites, for example), The Wiggles...the list goes on and on.  Keep looking!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My 3 and 6 year olds love these Little People videos but its definitely not for older kids.  This one is about how they all met and whats special about each of them.  The video has 10 short (about 7 min) episodes so toddlers with short attention spans can keep an interest in it or just watch one or two and not even have to finish the whole video.  The stories are well written and always have a good ending with a lesson to it.  The songs are good on them too.  The clay figures are cute and make these videos very unique.  We have several other Little People videos and have been very happy with them.
Title: N/A
